required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A 3-Month Clinical Trial to Assess the Safety and Efficacy of the OZURDEX速 Intraocular Implant in Patients With Diabetes Mellitus
clinical_study.official_title: A 3-Month Clinical Trial to Assess the Safety and Efficacy of the OZURDEX速 Intraocular Implant in Patients With Diabetes Mellitus

brief_summary.textblock: There is a need to find an effective therapy for diabetic patients who develop macular edema after cataract surgery.

detailed_description.textblock: The objective of this study is to assess the safety and efficacy of the OZURDEX速 intraocular implant in patients with diabetes mellitus, who develop macular edema after cataract surgery

primary_outcome.measure: Mean Change in Best Corrected Visual Acuity
Mean Change in Best Corrected Visual Acuity
Mean Change in Best Corrected Visual Acuity
Mean Change in Central Retinal Thickness
Mean Change in Central Retinal Thickness
Mean Change in Central Retinal Thickness

arm_group.description: OZURDEX (dexamethasone posterior segment drug delivery system (DEX PS DDS), 0.7 mg

arm_group.arm_group_label: Steroid plus NSAID eye drop combination therapy
arm_group.description: NSAID eye drop: Acular LS Steriod eye drop: Pred Forte

intervention.intervention_name: Steroid plus NSAID eye drop combination therapy
intervention.arm_group_label: Steroid plus NSAID eye drop combination therapy

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patient has diagnosis of Diabetes Mellitus, Type I or II.
- Patient has experienced the development of macular edema following cataract surgery in at least one eye.
- Patient has had cataract surgery within 90 days prior to the screening visit.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patient has other significant ocular disease in study eye, including glaucoma.
- Patient has any active infection in the study eye.
- Patient has uncontrolled systemic illness (i.e., uncontrolled blood pressure, uncontrolled diabetes mellitus).
- Patient has experienced a significant increase in intraocular pressure following a prior treatment with topical or intravitreal steroidal medication.
- Patient has received the OZURDEX速 implant before in the study eye.

group.title: OZURDEX Intraocular Implant
group.description: OZURDEX (dexamethasone posterior segment drug delivery system (DEX PS DDS), 0.7 mg Dexamethasone intravitreal implant

group.title: Steroid Plus NSAID Eye Drop Combination Therapy
group.description: NSAID eye drop: Acular LS Steriod eye drop: Pred Forte Steroid plus NSAID eye drop combination therapy

group.title: DEX IMPLANT ARM
group.description: Subects in the DEX implant arm received a single intravitreal administration of 0.7 mg OZURDEX in the study eye at the Day 0 appointment. In order to minimize subject discomfort, adequate local anesthesia was administered to the study eye prior to DEX implant injection. Immediately following DEX implant injection, the investigator performed indirect ophthalmic exam to assess for complications. In order to minimize risk of infection, a topical broad-spectrum antibiotic was placed in the study eye immediately prior to and following the injection, and the subject were provided a sample of a broad-spectrum antibiotic to use 4 times daily for 3 days following injection. The subject remained in the clinic for 15-30 minutes or until IOP <28 mmHg.

group.title: Topical Steroid/NSAID ARM
group.description: Subjects randomized to receive the steroid/NSAID eye drop combination therapy began treatment at Day 0. The first administration occurred in clinic. Subjects was instructed how to instill eye drops properly and to instill each drop in the study eye four times per day every day until month 1 visit. At each monthly visit, subjects in this arm were assessed for the need to continue steroid/NSAID therapy.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: Race and Ethnicity Not Collected
measure.population: Race and Ethnicity were not collected from any participant.

measure.title: Central Retinal Thickness
measure.description: Based on spectral domain optical coherence tomography (SD-OCT)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Limitations of our study include a small sample size and short-term follow up. Additional studies are needed to determine whether combination therapy with other treatments would be beneficial to patients.
